required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Analgesic Efficacy of XP21L in Subjects With Pain Following Bunionectomy Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Analgesic Efficacy of XP21L in Subjects With Pain Following Bunionectomy Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter study to evaluate the analgesic efficacy of XP21L in subjects with pain following bunionectomy surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Numeric Pain Rating Score (NPRS) Over 48 Hours After Bunionectomy
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity scores were measured using an 11-point numerical pain rating scale (NPRS) with 0=no pain to 10=worst possible pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Perceptible Pain Relief on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Times to onset of Perceptible and Meaningful Relief were determined using the double-stopwatch method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Onset of Pain Relief in Patients With Perceptible Pain Relief on Day 1
Number of Patients With Meaningful Pain Relief on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Times to onset of Perceptible and Meaningful Relief were determined using the double-stopwatch method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Onset of Pain Relief in Patients With Meaningful Pain Relief on Day 1
Total Pain Relief (TOTPAR) Scores 8 Hours Post Initial Dose of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.description: Pain relief was rated using a 5-point categorial scale (0=none, 1=a little, 2=some, 3=a lot, and 4=complete) at time of dose (time=0) and over 15 time points afterwards (10, 15, 20, 30, 45, and 60 minutes and at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after the initial dose on Day 1 or until time of re-medication). A score of 0 across all time points would be the lowest (worst) and a score of 60 (4 X 15 time points) would be the highest (best) possible score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With at Least 30% Reduction in Pain Intensity After First Dose of Study Drug
Time to Onset of at Least 30% Reduction in Pain Intensity After First Dose of Study Drug
Number of Patients Who Required Rescue Medication on Day 1
Number of Patients Who Required Rescue Medication on Day 2
Number of Patients Who Required Rescue Medication on Day 3
secondary_outcome.description: Day 3 data reflect the use of rescue medication only up to the time of discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-65 years of age
- Have undergone bunionectomy surgery
- Have achieved adequate post-surgical pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Confounding medical conditions which preclude study participation
- Participated in a study of another investigational drug or device within 30 days prior to randomization

responsible_party.name_title: Gary Shangold, M.D. / Chief Medical Officer

measure.description: Pain intensity scores were measured using an 11-point numerical pain rating scale (NPRS) with 0=no pain to 10=worst possible pain

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Perceptible Pain Relief on Day 1
outcome.description: Times to onset of Perceptible and Meaningful Relief were determined using the double-stopwatch method.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Perceptible Pain Relief on Day 1
measure.description: Times to onset of Perceptible and Meaningful Relief were determined using the double-stopwatch method.

outcome.title: Median Time to Onset of Pain Relief in Patients With Perceptible Pain Relief on Day 1
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed includes only the number of participants with perceptible pain relief on Day 1 (see previous outcome measure #2).

measure.title: Median Time to Onset of Pain Relief in Patients With Perceptible Pain Relief on Day 1
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed includes only the number of participants with perceptible pain relief on Day 1 (see previous outcome measure #2).

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Meaningful Pain Relief on Day 1
outcome.description: Times to onset of Perceptible and Meaningful Relief were determined using the double-stopwatch method.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Meaningful Pain Relief on Day 1
measure.description: Times to onset of Perceptible and Meaningful Relief were determined using the double-stopwatch method.

outcome.title: Median Time to Onset of Pain Relief in Patients With Meaningful Pain Relief on Day 1
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed includes only the number of participants with meaningful pain relief on Day 1 (see previous outcome measure #4). Number of patients in the placebo group is intentionally blank as the data (eg., median and upper CI) were not calculable (see post-hoc outcome measure #12 for available placebo results).

measure.title: Median Time to Onset of Pain Relief in Patients With Meaningful Pain Relief on Day 1
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed includes only the number of participants with meaningful pain relief on Day 1 (see previous outcome measure #4). Number of patients in the placebo group is intentionally blank as the data (eg., median and upper CI) were not calculable (see post-hoc outcome measure #12 for available placebo results).

outcome.title: Total Pain Relief (TOTPAR) Scores 8 Hours Post Initial Dose of Study Drug
outcome.description: Pain relief was rated using a 5-point categorial scale (0=none, 1=a little, 2=some, 3=a lot, and 4=complete) at time of dose (time=0) and over 15 time points afterwards (10, 15, 20, 30, 45, and 60 minutes and at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after the initial dose on Day 1 or until time of re-medication). A score of 0 across all time points would be the lowest (worst) and a score of 60 (4 X 15 time points) would be the highest (best) possible score.

measure.title: Total Pain Relief (TOTPAR) Scores 8 Hours Post Initial Dose of Study Drug
measure.description: Pain relief was rated using a 5-point categorial scale (0=none, 1=a little, 2=some, 3=a lot, and 4=complete) at time of dose (time=0) and over 15 time points afterwards (10, 15, 20, 30, 45, and 60 minutes and at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after the initial dose on Day 1 or until time of re-medication). A score of 0 across all time points would be the lowest (worst) and a score of 60 (4 X 15 time points) would be the highest (best) possible score.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With at Least 30% Reduction in Pain Intensity After First Dose of Study Drug

outcome.title: Time to Onset of at Least 30% Reduction in Pain Intensity After First Dose of Study Drug
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed includes only the number of participants with at least 30% reduction in pain intensity after first dose of study drug (see previous outcome measure #7).

measure.title: Time to Onset of at Least 30% Reduction in Pain Intensity After First Dose of Study Drug
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed includes only the number of participants with at least 30% reduction in pain intensity after first dose of study drug (see previous outcome measure #7).
